pageContext.claim: “I see what the Democrats are doing; it's a disaster what they're planning and everyone knows it. You're going to lose 180 million people under private insurance.”
pageContext.analysis: While some Democratic candidates, such as Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.), have supported a Medicare-for-all plan that would eliminate private insurance, that is is not a universal position. Trump’s numbers for private insurance are a little off. The Census Bureau says that in 2017, 217 million Americans had private insurance, with 181 million covered through an employer and 52 million directly purchasing it. Meanwhile, 123 million Americans are covered already through a government plan, such as Medicare, Medicaid or the military health system.
